00006 //Macro to convert sector coordinates (1-16,1-16) to 0-255
00007 #define SECTOR(x,y)                 ((y-1)*16+x-1)
00008 #define SECTORX(SectorID)     ((SectorID % 16) + 1)
00009 #define SECTORY(SectorID)     ((SectorID / 16) + 1)
00010

00054 //Various flag definitions

00056 #define SF_USE_MAP_SETTINGS                                       0x00000001
00057 #define SF_ENEMY_AMBUSH_LOCATION                            0x00000002
00058 
00059 //Special case flag used when players encounter enemies in a sector, then retreat.  The number of enemies
00060 //will display on mapscreen until time is compressed.  When time is compressed, the flag is cleared, and
00061 //a question mark is displayed to reflect that the player no longer knows.
00062 #define SF_PLAYER_KNOWS_ENEMIES_ARE_HERE              0x00000004  
00063 
00064 #define SF_SAM_SITE                                                     0x00000008
00065 #define SF_MINING_SITE                                            0x00000010
00066 #define SF_ALREADY_VISITED                                        0x00000020
00067 #define SF_USE_ALTERNATE_MAP                                0x00000040
00068 #define SF_PENDING_ALTERNATE_MAP                            0x00000080
00069 #define SF_ALREADY_LOADED                                         0x00000100
00070 #define SF_HAS_ENTERED_TACTICAL                                   0x00000200
00071 #define SF_SKYRIDER_NOTICED_ENEMIES_HERE              0x00000400
00072 #define SF_HAVE_USED_GUIDE_QUOTE                            0x00000800
00073 
00074 #define SF_SMOKE_EFFECTS_TEMP_FILE_EXISTS             0x00100000        //Temp File starts with sm_
00075 #define SF_LIGHTING_EFFECTS_TEMP_FILE_EXISTS          0x00200000        //Temp File starts with l_
00076 #define SF_REVEALED_STATUS_TEMP_FILE_EXISTS                 0x01000000        //Temp File starts with v_
00077 #define SF_DOOR_STATUS_TEMP_FILE_EXISTS                     0x02000000        //Temp File starts with ds_
00078 #define SF_ENEMY_PRESERVED_TEMP_FILE_EXISTS                 0x04000000        //Temp File starts with e_
00079 #define SF_CIV_PRESERVED_TEMP_FILE_EXISTS             0x08000000        //Temp File starts with c_
00080 #define SF_ITEM_TEMP_FILE_EXISTS                            0x10000000        //Temp File starts with i_
00081 #define SF_ROTTING_CORPSE_TEMP_FILE_EXISTS                  0x20000000        //Temp File starts with r_
00082 #define SF_MAP_MODIFICATIONS_TEMP_FILE_EXISTS         0x40000000        //Temp File starts with m_
00083 #define SF_DOOR_TABLE_TEMP_FILES_EXISTS                     0x80000000        //Temp File starts with d_

00109 //Vehicle types
00110 #define FOOT                  0x01 //anywhere
00111 #define CAR                   0x02 //roads
00112 #define TRUCK                 0x04 //roads, plains, sparse
00113 #define TRACKED               0x08 //roads, plains, sand, sparse
00114 #define AIR                   0x10 //can traverse all terrains at 100%
00115 
00116 //Traversability ratings
00117 enum
00118 {
00119       TOWN,                   //instant
00120       ROAD,                   //everything travels at 100%
00121       PLAINS,                       //foot 90%, truck 75%, tracked 100%
00122       SAND,                   //foot 70%, tracked 60%
00123       SPARSE,                       //foot 70%, truck 50%, tracked 60%
00124       DENSE,                        //foot 50% 
00125       SWAMP,                        //foot 20%
00126       WATER,                        //foot 15%
00127       HILLS,                        //foot 50%, truck 50%, tracked 50%
00128       GROUNDBARRIER,          //only air (super dense forest, ocean, etc.)
00129       NS_RIVER,               //river from north to south
00130       EW_RIVER,               //river from east to west
00131       EDGEOFWORLD,            //nobody can traverse.
00132 
00133       //NEW (not used for border values -- traversal calculations)
00134       TROPICS,
00135       FARMLAND,
00136       PLAINS_ROAD,
00137       SPARSE_ROAD,
00138       FARMLAND_ROAD,
00139       TROPICS_ROAD,
00140       DENSE_ROAD,
00141       COASTAL,
00142       HILLS_ROAD,
00143       COASTAL_ROAD,
00144       SAND_ROAD,
00145       SWAMP_ROAD,
00146 
00147       //only used for text purposes and not assigned to areas (SAM sites are hard coded throughout the code)
00148       SPARSE_SAM_SITE,        //D15 near Drassen
00149       SAND_SAM_SITE,                //I8 near Tixa
00150       TROPICS_SAM_SITE,       //D2 near Chitzena
00151       MEDUNA_SAM_SITE,        //N4 in Meduna
00152       CAMBRIA_HOSPITAL_SITE,

00154       MEDUNA_AIRPORT_SITE,

00166 };

00175 //Used by ubGarrisonID when a sector doesn't point to a garrison.  Used by strategic AI only.
00176 #define NO_GARRISON                             255
00177 
00178 typedef struct SECTORINFO
00179 {
00180       //information pertaining to this sector
00181       UINT32      uiFlags;                            //various special conditions
00182       UINT8 ubInvestigativeState;         //When the sector is attacked by the player, the state increases by 1 permanently.
00183                                                             //This value determines how quickly it is investigated by the enemy.
00184       UINT8 ubGarrisonID;                       //IF the sector has an ID for this (non 255), then the queen values this sector and it
00185                                                             //indexes the garrison group.
00186       INT8  ubPendingReinforcements;      //when the enemy owns this sector, this value will keep track of HIGH priority reinforcements -- not regular.
00187       BOOLEAN fMilitiaTrainingPaid;
00188       UINT8 ubMilitiaTrainingPercentDone;
00189       UINT8 ubMilitiaTrainingHundredths;
00190       //enemy military presence
00191       BOOLEAN     fPlayer[ 4 ];                       //whether the player THINKS the sector is unde his control or not. array is for sublevels
00192       //enemy only info
00193       UINT8 ubNumTroops;                        //the actual number of troops here.
00194       UINT8 ubNumElites;                        //the actual number of elites here.
00195       UINT8 ubNumAdmins;                        //the actual number of admins here.
00196       UINT8 ubNumCreatures;                     //only set when immediately before ground attack made!
00197       UINT8   ubTroopsInBattle, ubElitesInBattle, ubAdminsInBattle, ubCreaturesInBattle;
00198 
00199       INT8  bLastKnownEnemies;                  // -1 means never been there, no idea, otherwise it's what we'd observed most recently
00200                                                             // while this is being maintained (partially, surely buggy), nothing uses it anymore. ARM
00201 
00202       UINT32      ubDayOfLastCreatureAttack;
00203       UINT32      uiFacilitiesFlags;                  // the flags for various facilities
00204 
00205       UINT8 ubTraversability[5];          //determines the traversability ratings to adjacent sectors.
00206                                                             //The last index represents the traversability if travelling
00207                                                             //throught the sector without entering it.
00208       INT8  bNameId;
00209       INT8  bUSUSED;   
00210       INT8  bBloodCats;
00211       INT8  bBloodCatPlacements;
00212       INT8  UNUSEDbSAMCondition;
00213 
00214       UINT8 ubTravelRating;                     //Represents how travelled a sector is.  Typically, the higher the travel rating,
00215                                                             //the more people go near it.  A travel rating of 0 means there are never people
00216                                                             //around.  This value is used for determining how often items would "vanish" from
00217                                                             //a sector (nice theory, except it isn't being used that way.  Stealing is only in towns.  ARM)
00218       UINT8 ubNumberOfCivsAtLevel[ MAX_MILITIA_LEVELS ]; // town militia per experience class, 0/1/2 is GREEN/REGULAR/ELITE
00219       UINT16      usUNUSEDMilitiaLevels;                          // unused (ARM)
00220       UINT8 ubUNUSEDNumberOfJoeBlowCivilians;         // unused (ARM)
00221       UINT32      uiTimeCurrentSectorWasLastLoaded;         //Specifies the last time the player was in the sector
00222       UINT8 ubUNUSEDNumberOfEnemiesThoughtToBeHere;   // using bLastKnownEnemies instead
00223       UINT32      uiTimeLastPlayerLiberated;                      //in game seconds (used to prevent the queen from attacking for awhile)
00224 
00225       BOOLEAN fSurfaceWasEverPlayerControlled;
00226 
00227       UINT8 bFiller1;
00228       UINT8 bFiller2;
00229       UINT8 bFiller3;
00230 
00231       UINT32      uiNumberOfWorldItemsInTempFileThatCanBeSeenByPlayer;
00232 
00233       INT8  bPadding[ 41 ];
00234 
00235 }SECTORINFO;

00237 #define NO_ADJACENT_SECTOR          0x00
00238 #define NORTH_ADJACENT_SECTOR 0x01
00239 #define EAST_ADJACENT_SECTOR  0x02
00240 #define SOUTH_ADJACENT_SECTOR 0x04
00241 #define WEST_ADJACENT_SECTOR  0x08

00244 typedef struct UNDERGROUND_SECTORINFO
00245 {
00246       UINT32      uiFlags;
00247       UINT8 ubSectorX, ubSectorY, ubSectorZ;
00248       UINT8 ubNumElites, ubNumTroops, ubNumAdmins, ubNumCreatures;
00249       UINT8 fVisited;
00250       INT8  ubTravelRating;                     //Represents how travelled a sector is.  Typically, the higher the travel rating,
00251                                                             //the more people go near it.  A travel rating of 0 means there are never people
00252                                                             //around.  This value is used for determining how often items would "vanish" from
00253                                                             //a sector.
00254       UINT32      uiTimeCurrentSectorWasLastLoaded;         //Specifies the last time the player was in the sector
00255       struct      UNDERGROUND_SECTORINFO *next;
00256       UINT8 ubAdjacentSectors;                  //mask containing which sectors are adjacent
00257       UINT8 ubCreatureHabitat;                  //determines how creatures live in this sector (see creature spreading.c)
00258       UINT8 ubElitesInBattle, ubTroopsInBattle, ubAdminsInBattle, ubCreaturesInBattle;
00259 
00260       UINT32      uiNumberOfWorldItemsInTempFileThatCanBeSeenByPlayer;
00261       INT8  bPadding[36];
00262       //no padding left!
00263 }UNDERGROUND_SECTORINFO;
00264 
00265 //The sector information required for the strategic AI.  Contains the number of enemy troops,
00266 //as well as intentions, etc.
00267 extern SECTORINFO SectorInfo[256];
00268 extern UNDERGROUND_SECTORINFO *gpUndergroundSectorInfoHead;
